1.the_question: You are a mercenary tasked with escorting a goods-laden cart down a dangerous road. Pacing ahead of the cart with your fellow mercenary Jarret, you spy a goblin in the middle of the road. Jarret shouts, 'Look! We should kill it!'

2.the_question: You agree to attack the goblin, drawing your broadsword from its sheath. The goblin stares at you, perfectly still. Do you...

3.the_question: You talk Jarret out of attacking the lone goblin. 'What else do you suggest?' he asks.

4.the_question: You charge forward. Halfway to the goblin, the ground gives way underneath your feet - a trap! The last thing you see is a pit of wooden spikes hurtling towards you.

5.the_question: Approaching carefully, you notice a discolouration in the ground, stones and twigs suspiciously arranged in a circle, most the width of the road. A trap, no doubt. You pat yourself on the back for your keen observation.

6.the_question: You try to talk to the goblin, then remember you don't speak goblin. You've made a fool of yourself in front of Jarret, the driver of the cart, and the goblin. You almost die of shame. Now what?

7.the_question: You wait, fingers brushing the hilt of your weapon, sweaty with anticipation...

30.the_question: The goblin gets frustrated by all this standing around and beckons you closer, jabbing a clawpoint at a discoloured section of the road, stones and twigs suspiciously arranged in a wide circle. A trap.
30.answer_a: Oblige the goblin and step onto the trap
30.answer_b: Laugh at the goblin for revealing its trap

23.the_question: The discoloured ground crumbles under the weight of your foot and you tumble into a pit. The last thing you see is an arrangement of wooden spikes hurtling towards you. But you did make the goblin feel a little less embarrassed - so there's that.

24.the_question: You and Jarret point and laugh. The goblin hops up and down in a rage, you don't speak goblin but you're quite sure it's swearing.

25.the_question: You and Jarret draw your broadswords.

26.the_question: You guide the cart around the trap, keeping an eye on the dejected goblin. He eventually slinks off in embarrassment. You and Jarret can only chuckle. You press on.

8.the_question: You launch yourself over the trap, boots skidding in the mud on the other side. Jarret, distracted by this feat of athleticism, steps on the discoloured ground. It collapses and drops him into a pit of stakes which brutally skewer him to death.
8.answer_b: Shrug. You get his cut of the pay.

9.the_question: 'It's a trap!' you call out to Jarret, pointing to the discolored ground.

29.the_question: You and Jarret leap over the trap, rolling like action heroes as you land on the other side. The goblin now looks rather alarmed and starts backing away.

18.the_question: You and Jarret fly at the terrified goblin, who turns to flee.

20.the_question: You cut the goblin's legs out from under it and take turns with Jarret gleefully stabbing the short ragged creature to death. Then you guide the cart around the trap, enjoying some bread with the driver in celebration of your epic victory.

19.the_question: The goblin manages to flee off the road and disappears into the trees. Having driven the creature off, you guide the cart around the trap.

28.the_question: More goblins begin to emerge out of the trees on both sides, approaching menacingly. Five, then ten, then more than a dozen. Reinforcements.

21.the_question: You cut down one of the approaching goblins, and another.

31.the_question: Then you feel a unbelievable sharp pain in your back and look down to see a set of bloody claws poking out through your chest. You reflect that two against a dozen was probably a silly idea. But at least the shareholders will know you committed to the job.

22.the_question: You run away, before they can surround you, Jarret follows at your heel. You hear the cart driver screaming in the distance behind you as the goblins tear him to shreds. You failed the mission, but at least you're still alive. Jarret starts talking about the next job...

10.the_question: The goblin is unexpectedly moved by this dramatic and emotional display of grief and steps forward, reaching a hand out in sympathy.

11.the_question: Now that you're alone, the goblin meets your charge, claws first. Its stocky chest is wrapped in beaten leather armour.

27.the_question: Your cut gashes the goblin's leather armour, but does not reach flesh. In a flash, the goblin's claws slice through your right forearm. The limb and your sword drop to the dirt.

36.the_question: You escape back down the path, leaving the cart and driver behind. Night falls, and despite tending to your wounds, you're in a barren road in the middle of a dangerous goblin-filled forest, unarmed, bleeding and probably infected. Outcome: not brilliant.

37.the_question: You pick up your sword in your left hand, stating 'I've had worse'. The goblin promptly takes that arm too.

38.the_question: You kick the goblin. Annoyed and befuddled, it casually slices off your kicking leg.

39.the_question: You hop at the goblin on your remaining limb and repeatedly bump it with your shoulder and chest. The goblin sighs and slices your hopping leg.

40.the_question: Looking down at your limbless torso, the goblin claps its clawed hands together in appreciation of your persistence and commitment to the Monty Python reference. It decides to spare you and the cart, stalking back into the woods.
40.answer_c: 'Running away, eh? You yellow bastard! Come back here and take what's coming to ya! I'll bite your legs off!'

12.the_question: The goblin reaches up and places a comforting claw on your shoulder. He cannot speak the human tongue, but it is clear in his body language that he deeply regrets his actions.

14.the_question: The goblin apologetically helps you retrieve Jarret's body from the pit, digs a respectful grave for him with its claws and shows the cart driver the way around its trap. He bows his head and beckons you on your way.
14.answer_b: Refuse to look at the goblin

15.the_question: You take the goblin by the wrist and plunge your broadsword through its neck.

32.the_question: You hurriedly try and think of a line.
32.answer_a: Caught you in the NECK of time!

34.the_question: Over the gurgling, choking sounds of the dying goblin, you're quite sure you hear the cart driver booing you. Embarrassed, you guide the cart around the trap and never speak of this again.

35.the_question: The cart driver cheers triumphantly at your epic victory. Chest puffed out, you guide the cart around the trap. But inwardly you know you definitely stole that quip from something and the secret shame weighs on you.

33.the_question: You watch it die, eyes wide in surprise. As you guide the cart around the trap, the driver looks at you with fear. You think to yourself: good.

16.the_question: You press on with the cart, and the goblin walks away a changed man (or humanoid), intent on cleaning up his act and living a good life. He will never forget Jarret.

17.the_question: The goblin slumps his shoulders and you press on down the road. You hear a sharp scream from behind, and look back to see the goblin, wracked with guilt, has thrown himself into his own spike pit.
